00013 #ifndef SPHERE_H
00014 #define SPHERE_H

00016 #include <geometry/Geometry.hpp>
00017 #include <geometry/Vec3.hpp>
00018 #include <geometry/Box3.hpp>
00019 #include <geometry/Ray.hpp>

00021 namespace geo
00022 {
00032     template<typename Type>
00033     class Sphere
00034     {
00035     public:
00037         Sphere()
00038         {
00039             m_center.setValue(0.0,0.0,0.0);
00040             m_radius = 1;
00041         }
00042 
00044         Sphere(const Sphere<Type> & a_sphere)
00045         {
00046             setValue(a_sphere.m_center, a_sphere.m_radius);
00047         }
00048 
00050         Sphere(const Vec3<Type> &c, Type r)
00051         {
00052             setValue(c,r);
00053         }
00054 
00056         Sphere(const Vec3<Type> & p1, const Vec3<Type> & p2)
00057         {
00058             setPoles(p1, p2); 
00059         }
00060 
00062         Sphere(const std::vector< Vec3<Type> > & points)
00063         {
00064             //based on the algorithm given by [Jack Ritter, 1990]
00065             if(points.empty()) return;
00066 
00067             // find a large diameter to start with
00068             // first get the bounding box
00069             Box3<Type> bbox;
00070             for(unsigned int i=0; i<points.size(); i++){
00071                 bbox.extendBy(points[i]);
00072             }
00073 
00074             setPoles(bbox.getMin(), bbox.getMax());
00075 
00076             m_radius /= (Type)2.0;
00077 
00078             for(unsigned int i=0; i<points.size(); i++){
00079                 extendBy(points[i]);
00080             }
00081         }
00082 
00084         virtual ~Sphere(){}
00085 
00087         void setValue(const Vec3<Type> &c, Type r)
00088         {
00089             m_center = c;
00090             m_radius = r;
00091         }
00092 
00094         void setPoles(const Vec3<Type> & p1, const Vec3<Type> & p2)
00095         {
00096             m_center = (Type)0.5 * (p1 + p2);
00097             m_radius = (Type)0.5 * (p1 - p2).length();
00098         }
00099 
00101         void setCenter(const Vec3<Type> &c)
00102         {
00103             m_center = c;
00104         }
00105 
00107         void setRadius(Type r)
00108         {
00109             m_radius = r;
00110         }
00111 
00113         const Vec3<Type> & getCenter() const
00114         { 
00115             return m_center; 
00116         }
00117 
00119         Type getRadius() const
00120         { 
00121             return m_radius; 
00122         }
00123 
00125         Type getVolume() const
00126         {
00127             return (Type)(M_PI * (4.0 / 3.0) * std::pow(m_radius, 3));
00128         }
00129 
00131         Type getSurface() const
00132         {
00133             return (Type)(M_PI * 4.0 * std::pow(m_radius, 2));
00134         }
00135 
00137         void circumscribe(const Box3<Type> &box)
00138         {
00139             m_center = box.getCenter();
00140             m_radius = (box.getMax() - m_center).length();
00141         }
00142 
00144         void extendBy(const Vec3<Type> &a_point)
00145         {
00146             if(intersect(a_point)) return;
00147 
00148             Vec3<Type> dir = m_center - a_point;
00149 
00150             dir.normalize();
00151 
00152             Vec3<Type> p1 = m_center + m_radius * dir;
00153 
00154             setPoles(p1, a_point);
00155         }
00156 
00158         void extendBy(const Sphere<Type> &sphere)
00159         {
00160             if(intersect(sphere)) return;
00161 
00162             Vec3<Type> dir = m_center - sphere.getCenter();
00163 
00164             dir.normalize();
00165 
00166             Vec3<Type> p1 = m_center + m_radius * dir;
00167             Vec3<Type> p2 = sphere.getCenter() - sphere.getRadius() * dir;
00168 
00169             setPoles(p1, p2);
00170         }
00171 
00173         bool intersect(const Vec3<Type> &p) const
00174         {
00175             return (p - m_center).sqrLength() < m_radius*m_radius;
00176         }
00177 
00179         bool intersect(const Sphere<Type> & s) const
00180         {
00181             Type d1 = (s.getCenter() - m_center).sqrLength();
00182             Type d2 = m_radius + s.getRadius();
00183 
00184             return (  d1 < d2*d2 );
00185         }
00186 
00188         bool intersect(const Ray<Type> & r, Type & t0, Type & t1) const
00189         {
00190             Vec3<Type> r_to_s = r.getOrigin() - m_center;
00191 
00192             //Compute A, B and C coefficients
00193             Type A = r.getDirection().sqrLength();
00194             Type B = 2.0f * r_to_s.dot(r.getDirection());
00195             Type C = r_to_s.sqrLength() - m_radius*m_radius;
00196 
00197             //Find discriminant
00198             Type disc = B * B - 4.0 * A * C;
00199 
00200             // if discriminant is negative there are no real roots
00201             if(disc < 0.0) return false;
00202 
00203             disc = (Type)std::sqrt((double)disc);
00204 
00205             t0 = (-B+disc)/(2.0*A);
00206             t1 = (-B-disc)/(2.0*A);
00207 
00208             // check if we're inside it
00209             if(t0 < 0.0 && t1 > 0 || t0 > 0 && t1 < 0) return false;
00210 
00211             if(t0 > t1) std::swap(t0, t1);
00212 
00213             return (t0 > 0);
00214         }
00215 
00217         bool intersect(const Box3<Type> &b) const
00218         {
00219             // Arvo's algorithm.
00220             Type d = 0; 
00221 
00222             //find the square of the distance from the sphere to the box
00223             for( unsigned int i=0 ; i<3 ; i++ ){ 
00224                 if( m_center[i] < b.getMin()[i] ){
00225                     Type s = m_center[i] - b.getMin()[i];
00226                     d += s*s; 
00227                 }
00228                 else if( m_center[i] > b.getMax()[i] ){ 
00229                     Type s = m_center[i] - b.getMax()[i];
00230                     d += s*s; 
00231                 }
00232             }
00233             return d <= m_radius*m_radius;
00234         }
00235 
00237         void getUniformSurfacePoints(std::vector< Vec3<Type> > & points, unsigned int N)
00238         {
00239             // "generalized spiral set" [Saff and Kuijlaars, 1997]
00240             points.resize(N);
00241 
00242             Type theta = 0.0;
00243             for(unsigned int k=1; k<=N; k++){
00244                 Type cosphi = (Type)(-1.0 + 2.0 * (k - 1) / (Type)( N - 1 ));
00245                 Type sinphi = (Type)std::sqrt ( 1.0 - cosphi*cosphi );
00246 
00247                 if ( k == 1 || k == N ) theta = 0.0;
00248                 else theta += (Type)3.6 / ( sinphi * std::sqrt ( (Type)N ) );
00249 
00250                 points[k-1] = Vec3<Type>(m_radius * sinphi * std::cos ( theta ),
00251                                          m_radius * sinphi * std::sin ( theta ),
00252                                          m_radius * cosphi);
00253             }
00254         }
00255 
00257         friend bool operator ==(const Sphere<Type> & s1, const Sphere<Type> & s2)
00258         { 
00259             return(s1.m_center == s2.m_center&& s1.m_radius == s2.m_radius); 
00260         }
00261 
00263         friend bool operator !=(const Sphere<Type> & s1, const Sphere<Type> & s2)
00264         { 
00265             return !(s1 == s2); 
00266         }
00267 
00268     private:
00269         Vec3<Type>  m_center;   
00270         Type        m_radius;   
00271     };
